newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Second blast in Gaza Strip, no word of casualties.
newsitem.headline: Second blast in Gaza Strip, no word of casualties.

text.p: A bomb exploded near a bus carrying children of Jewish settlers in the Gaza Strip, the second such blast in Gaza on Tuesday, security sources said.
There were no immediate reports of casualties, they said.
They said the blast occurred near Netzarim settlement, just as a bus of schoolchidren was leaving the heavily guarded enclave.

Earlier a bomb exploded on a horsecart near an Israeli checkpoint less than one km (half a mile) from Kfar Darom settlement, they said. The sources said there may have been Palestinian casualties in the Kfar Darom blast.

The area has been especially tense in recent weeks, as the Israeli-Palestinian peace process plunged into crisis over work on a new Jewish settlement in Arab East Jerusalem. Daily clashes have ensued, and last month an Islamist suicide bomber killed three women in a Tel Aviv cafe.
In the past Palestinians have mounted attacks both in Kfar Darom and Netzarim.
